column4: Dixerunt autem viri ad Lot: Habes hic quempiam tuorum? Generum et filios et filias et omnes, qui tui sunt in urbe, educ de loco hoc: delebimus enim locum istum, eo quod increverit clamor contra eos coram Domino, qui misit nos, ut perdamus eam.

column2: So Lot went out, and spoke to his sons in law that were to have his daughters, and said: Arise: get you out of this place, because the Lord will destroy this city. And he seemed to them to speak as it were in jest.
column4: Egressus itaque Lot locutus est ad generos suos, qui accepturi erant filias eius, et dixit: "Surgite, egredimini de loco isto, quia delebit Dominus civitatem". Et visus est eis quasi ludens loqui.

column2: And when it was morning, the angels pressed him, saying: Arise, take thy wife, and the two daughters that thou hast: lest thou also perish in the wickedness of the city.
column4: Cumque esset mane, cogebant eum angeli dicentes: Surge, tolle uxorem tuam et duas filias, quas habes hic, ne pereas in scelere civitatis.

column2: And as he lingered, they took his hand, and the hand of his wife, and of his two daughters, because the Lord spared him.
column4: Tardante illo, apprehenderunt viri manum eius et manum uxoris ac duarum filiarum eius, eo quod parceret Dominus illi. Et eduxerunt eum posueruntque extra civitatem.

column2: And they brought him forth, and set him without the city: and there they spoke to him, saying: Save thy life: look not back, neither stay thou in all the country about: but save thy self in the mountain, lest thou be also consumed.
column4: Ibi locutus est: Salvare, agitur de vita tua; noli respicere post tergum, nec stes in omni circa regione; sed in monte salvum te fac, ne pereas.

column2: And Lot said to them: I beseech thee, my Lord, Because thy servant hath found grace before thee, and thou hast magnified thy mercy, which thou hast shewn to me, in saving my life, and I cannot escape to the mountain, lest some evil seize me, and I die.
column4: Dixitque Lot ad eos: Non, quæso, Domine. Ecce invenit servus tuus gratiam coram te, et magnificasti misericordiam tuam, quam fecisti mecum, ut salvares animam meam; nec possum in monte salvari, ne forte apprehendat me malum et moriar.

column2: There is this city here at hand, to which I may flee, it is a little one, and I shall be saved in it: is it not a little one, and my soul shall live?
column4: Ecce, civitas hæc iuxta, ad quam possum fugere, parva, et salvabor in ea numquid non modica est? et vivet anima mea.

column2: And he said to him: Behold also in this, I have heard thy prayers, not to destroy the city for which thou hast spoken.
column4: Dixitque ad eum: Ecce, etiam in hoc suscepi preces tuas, ut non subvertam urbem, pro qua locutus es.

column2: Make haste, and be saved there: because I cannot do any thing till thou go in thither. Therefore the name of that city was called Segor.
column4: Festina et salvare ibi, quia non potero facere quidquam, donec ingrediaris illuc. Idcirco vocatum est nomen urbis illius Segor.

column2: The sun was risen upon the earth, and Lot entered into Segor.
column4: Sol egressus est super terram, et Lot ingressus est Segor.

column2: And the Lord rained upon Sodom and Gomorrha brimstone and fire from the Lord out of heaven. And he destroyed these cities, and all the country about, all the inhabitants of the cities, and all things that spring from the earth.
column4: Igitur Dominus pluit super Sodomam et Gomorram sulphur et ignem a Domino de cælo et subvertit civitates has et omnem circa regionem, universos habitatores urbium et cuncta terræ virentia.

column2: And his wife looking behind her, was turned into a statue of salt.
column4: Respiciensque uxor eius post se versa est in statuam salis.

column2: And Abraham got up early in the morning, and in the place where he had stood before with the Lord: He looked towards Sodom and Gomorrha, and the whole land of that country: and he saw the ashes rise up from the earth as the smoke of a furnace.
column4: Abraham autem consurgens mane venit ad locum, ubi steterat prius cum Domino, intuitus est Sodomam et Gomorram et universam terram regionis illius; viditque ascendentem favillam de terra quasi fornacis fumum.

column2: Now when God destroyed the cities of that country, remembering Abraham, he delivered Lot out of the destruction of the cities wherein he had dwelt.
column4: Cum enim subverteret Deus civitates regionis illius, recordatus Abrahæ liberavit Lot de subversione urbium, in quibus habitaverat.

column2: And Lot went up out of Segor, and abode in the mountain, and his two daughters with him (for he was afraid to stay in Segor) and he dwelt in a cave, he and his two daughters with him.
column4: Ascenditque Lot de Segor et mansit in monte, duæ quoque filiæ eius cum eo; timuerat enim manere in Segor. Et mansit in spelunca ipse et duæ filiæ eius.

column2: And the elder said to the younger: Our father is old, and there is no man left on the earth, to come in unto us after the manner of the whole earth.
column4: Dixitque maior ad minorem: Pater noster senex est, et nullus virorum remansit in terra, qui possit ingredi ad nos iuxta morem universæ terræ.

column2: Come, let us make him drunk with wine, and let us lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.
column4: Veni, inebriemus patrem nostrum vino dormiamusque cum eo, ut servare possimus ex patre nostro semen.

column2: And they made their father drink wine that night: and the elder went in, and lay with her father: but he perceived not, neither when his daughter lay down, nor when she rose up.
column4: Dederunt itaque patri suo bibere vinum nocte illa, et ingressa est maior dormivitque cum patre; at ille non sensit, nec quando acccubuit filia nec quando surrexit.

column2: And the next day the elder said to the younger: Behold I lay last night with my father, let us make him drink wine also to night, and thou shalt lie with him, that we may save seed of our father.
column4: Altera quoque die dixit maior ad minorem: Ecce, dormivi heri cum patre meo; demus ei bibere vinum etiam hac nocte, et ingressa dormies cum eo, ut salvemus semen de patre nostro.

column2: They made their father drink wine that night also, and the younger daughter went in, and lay with him: and neither then did he perceive when she lay down, nor when she rose up.
column4: Dederunt et illa nocte patri suo bibere vinum, ingressaque minor flia dormivit cum eo; et ne tunc quidem sensit, quando illa concubuerit vel quando surrexit.

column2: So the two daughters of Lot were with child by their father.
column4: Conceperunt ergo duæ filiæ Lot de patre suo.

column2: And the elder bore a son, and she called his name Moab: he is the father of the Moabites unto this day.
column4: Peperitque maior filium et vocavit nomen eius Moab; ipse est pater Moabitarum usque in præsentem diem.

column2: The younger also bore a son, and she called his name Ammon; that is, the son of my people: he is the father of the Ammonites unto this day.
column4: Minor quoque peperit filium et vocavit nomen eius Benammi (id est Filius populi mei); ipse est pater Ammonitarum usque hodie.

column2: Abraham removed from thence to the south country, and dwelt between Cades and Sur, and sojourned in Gerara.
column4: Profectus inde Abraham in terram Nageb, habitavit inter Cades et Sur et peregrinatus est in Geraris.

column2: And he said of Sara his wife: She is my sister. So Abimelech the king of Gerara sent, and took her.
column4: Dixitque de Sara uxore sua: "Soror mea est". Misit ergo Abimelech rex Geraræ et tulit eam.

column2: And God came to Abimelech in a dream by night, and he said to him: Lo thou shalt die for the woman that thou hast taken: for she hath a husband.
column4: Venit autem Deus ad Abimelech per somnium nocte et ait illi: En morieris propter mulierem, quem tulisti; habet enim virum.

column2: Now Abimelech had not touched her, and he said: Lord, wilt thou slay a nation that is ignorant and just?
column4: Abimelech vero non tetigerat eam. Et ait: Domine, num gentem etiam justam interficies?

column2: Did not he say to me: She is my sister: and she say, He is my brother? in the simplicity of my heart, and cleanness of my hands have I done this.
column4: Nonne ipse dixit mihi: "Soror mea est", et ipsa quoque ait: "Frater meus est"? In simplicitate cordis mei et munditia manuum mearum feci hoc.

column2: And God said to him: And I know that thou didst it with a sincere heart: and therefore I withheld thee from sinning against me, and I suffered thee not to touch her.
column4: Dixitque ad eum Deus per somnium: Et ego scio quod simplici corde feceris; et ideo custodivi te, ne peccares in me, et non dimisi, ut tangeres eam.

column2: Now therefore restore the man his wife, for he is a prophet: and he shall pray for thee, and thou shalt live: but if thou wilt not restore her, know that thou shalt surely die, thou and all that are thine.
column4: Nunc igitur redde viro suo uxorem, quia propheta est; et orabit pro te, et vives; si autem nolueris reddere, scito quod morte morieris tu et omnia, quæ tua sunt.

column2: And Abimelech forthwith rising up in the night, called all his servants: and spoke all these words in their hearing, and all the men were exceedingly afraid.
column4: Statimque de nocte consurgens Abimelech vocavit omnes servos suos et locutus est universa verba hæc in auribus eorum; timueruntque viri valde.

column2: And Abimelech called also for Abraham, and said to him: What hast thou done to us? what have we offended thee in, that thou hast brought upon me and upon my kingdom a great sin? thou hast done to us what thou oughtest not to do.
column4: Vocavit autem Abimelech etiam Abraham et dixit ei: Quid fecisti nobis? Quid peccavi in te, qui induxisti super me et super regnum meum peccatum grande? Quæ non debuisti facere, fecisti mihi.

column2: And again he expostulated with him, and said: What sawest thou, that thou hast done this?
column4: Rursusque ait: Quid vidisti, ut hoc faceres?

column2: Abraham answered: I thought with myself, saying: Perhaps there is not the fear of God in this place: and they will kill me for the sake of my wife:
column4: Respondit Abraham: Cogitavi mecum: Certe non est timor Dei in loco isto, et interficient me propter uxorem meam.

column2: Howbeit, otherwise also she is truly my sister, the daughter of my father, and not the daughter of my mother, and I took her to wife.
column4: Alias autem et vere soror mea est, filia patris mei et non filia matris meæ, et duxi eam in uxorem.

column2: And after God brought me out of my father's house, I said to her: Thou shalt do me this kindness: In every place, to which we shall come, thou shalt say that I am thy brother.
column4: Cum autem vagari me faceret Deus de domo patris mei, dixi ad eam: Hanc misericordiam facies mecum: in omni loco, ad quem ingrediemur, dices quod frater tuus sim.

column2: And Abimelech took sheep and oxen, and servants and handmaids, and gave to Abraham: and restored to him Sara his wife. And said: The land is before you, dwell wheresoever it shall please thee.
column4: Tulit igitur Abimelech oves et boves et servos et ancillas et dedit Abraham; reddiditque illi Saram uxorem suam et ait: Ecce terra mea coram te; ubicumque tibi placuerit, habita.

column2: And to Sara he said: Behold I have given thy brother a thousand pieces of silver, this shall serve thee for a covering of thy eyes to all that are with thee, and whithersoever thou shalt go: and remember thou wast taken.
column4: Saræ autem dixit: Ecce mille argenteos dedi fratre tuo; ecce hoc erit tibi in velamen oculorum ad omnes, qui tecum sunt, et apud omnes iustificaberis.

column2: And when Abraham prayed, God healed Abimelech and his wife, and his handmaids, and they bore children: For the Lord had closed up every womb of the house of Abimelech, on account of Sara, Abraham's wife.
column4: Orante autem Abraham, sanavit Deus Abimelech et uxorem ancillasque eius et pepererunt; concluserat enim Dominus omnem vulvam domus Abimelech propter Saram uxorem Abraham.

column2: I don't want to see you here again.
In the mean time God said to Jacob: Arise and go up to Bethel, and dwell there, and make there an altar to God, who appeared to thee when thou didst flee from Esau, thy brother.
column4: Locutus est Deus ad Iacob: Surge et ascende Bethel et habita ibi; facque altare Deo, qui apparuit tibi, quando fugiebas Esau fratrem tuum.

column2: And Jacob having called together all his household, said: Cast away the strange gods that are among you, and be cleansed, and change your garments.
column4: Iacob vero, convocata omni domo sua, ait: Abigite deos alienos, qui in medio vestri sunt, et mundamini ac mutate vestimenta vestra.

column2: Arise, and let us go up to Bethel, that we may make there an altar to God; who heard me in the day of my affliction, and accompained me in my journey.
column4: Surgamus et ascendamus in Bethel, ut faciamus ibi altare Deo, qui exaudivit me in die tribulationis meæ et socius fuit itineris mei.

column2: So they gave him all the strange gods they had, and the earrings which were in their ears: and he buried them under the turpentine tree, that is behind the city of Sichem.
column4: Dederunt ergo ei omnes deos alienos, quos habebant, et inaures, quæ erant in auribus eorum; at ille infodit ea subter Quercum, quæ est prope urbem Sichem.

column2: And when they were departed, the terror of God fell upon all the cities round about, and they durst not pursue after them as they went away.
column4: Cumque profecti essent, terror Dei invasit omnes per circuitum civitates, et non sunt ausi persequi filios Iacob.

column2: And Jacob came to Luza, which is in the land of Canaan, surnamed Bethel: he and all the people that were with him.
column4: Venit igitur Iacob Luzam, quæ est in terra Chanaan, id est Bethel, ipse et omnis populus cum eo.

column2: And he built there an altar, and called the name of that place, The house of God: for there God appeared to him when he fled from his brother.
column4: Aedificavitque ibi altare et appellavit nomen loci illius Deus Bethel; ibi enim apparuit ei Deus, cum fugeret fratrem suum.

column2: At the same time Debora, the nurse of Rebecca, died, and was buried at the foot of Bethel, under an oak, and the name of that place was called, The oak of weeping.
column4: Eodem tempore mortua est Debora nutrix Rebeccæ et sepulta est ad radices Bethel subter quercum; vocatumque est nomen loci illius Quercus fletus.

column2: And God appeared again to Jacob, after he returned from Mesopotamia of Syria, and he blessed him, saying: Thou shalt not be called any more Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name. And he called him Israel.
column4: Apparuit iterum Deus Iacob, postquam reversus est de Paddanaram, benedixitque ei dicens: "Non vocaberis ultra Iacob, sed Israel erit nomen tuum”, et appellavit eum Israel.

column2: And said to him: I am God almighty, increase thou and be multiplied. Nations and peoples of nations shall be from thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins.
column4: Dixitque ei: Ego Deus omnipotens. Cresce et multiplicare; gens et congregatio nationum erunt ex te, reges de lumbis tuis egredientur.

column2: And the land which I gave to Abraham and Isaac, I will give to thee, and to thy seed after thee.
column4: Terramque, quam dedi Abraham et Isaac, dabo tibi; et semini tuo post te dabo terram hanc.

column2: But he set up a monument of stone, in the place where God had spoken to him: pouring drink-offerings upon it, and pouring oil thereon: and calling the name of that place Bethel.
column4: Ille vero erexit titulum lapideum in loco, quo locutus ei fuerat Deus, libans super eum libamina et effundens oleum vocansque nomen loci illius Bethel.

column2: And going forth from thence, he came in the spring time to the land which leadeth to Ephrata: wherein when Rachel was in travail, by reason of her hard labour, she began to be in danger, and the midwife said to her: Fear not, for thou shalt have this son also.
column4: Egressi sunt de Bethel. Et adhuc spatium quoddam erat usque ad Ephratham, cum parturiret Rachel; ob difficultatem partus periclitari cœpit, dixitque ei obstetrix: Noli timere, quia et hac vice habes filium.

column2: And when her soul was departing for pain, and death was now at hand, she called the name of her son Benoni, that is, the son of my pain: but his father called him Benjamin, that is, the son of the right hand.
column4: Egrediente autem anima et imminente iam morte, vocavit nomen filii sui Benoni (id est Filius doloris mei); pater vero appellavit eum Beniamin (id est Filius dextræ).

column2: So Rachel died, and was buried in the highway that leadeth to Ephrata, this is Bethlehem.
column4: Mortua est ergo Rachel et sepulta est in via, quæ ducit Ephratham; hæc est Bethlehem.

column2: And Jacob erected a pillar over her sepulchre: this is the pillar of Rachel's monument, to this day.
column4: Erexitque Iacob titulum super sepulcrum eius; hic est titulus monumenti Rachel usque in præsentem diem.

column2: Departing thence, he pitched his tent beyond the Flock tower.
column4: Egressus inde Israel, fixit tabernaculum trans Magdaleder (id est Turris gregis).

column2: And when he dwelt in that country, Ruben went, and slept with Bala the concubine of his father: which he was not ignorant of.
column4: Cumque habitaret in illa regione, abiit Ruben et dormivit cum Bilha concubina patris sui; quod illum minime latuit.

column2: Now the sons of Jacob were twelve.
And he came to Isaac his father in Mambre, the city of Arbee, this is Hebron: wherein Abraham and Isaac sojourned.
column4: Venit Iacob ad Isaac patrem suum in Mambre Cariatharbe, id est Hebron, ubi peregrinatus est Abraham et Isaac.

column2: And the days of Isaac were a hundred and eighty years. And being spent with age he died, and was gathered to his people, being old and full of days: and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
column4: Et completi sunt dies Isaac centum octoginta annorum; consumptusque ætate mortuus est et appositus est populo suo senex et plenus dierum. Et sepelierunt eum Esau et Iacob filii sui.

column2: And Esau took his wives, and his sons and daughters, and every soul of his house, and his substance, and cattle, and all that he was able to acquire in the land of Canaan: and went into another country, and departed from his brother Jacob.
column4: Tulit autem Esau uxores suas et filios et filias et omnes animas domus suæ et pecora armenta et cuncta, quæ acquisierat in terra Chanaan, et abiit in terram Seir; recessitque a fratre suo Iacob.

column2: For they were exceeding rich, and could not dwell together: neither was the land in which they sojourned able to bear them, for the multitude of their flocks.
column4: Divites enim erant valde et simul habitare non poterant; nec sustinebat eos terra peregrinationis eorum præ multitudine gregum.

column2: And the Lord visited Sara, as he had promised: and fulfilled what he had spoken. And she conceived and bore a son in her old age, at the time that God had foretold her.
column4: Visitavit autem Dominus Saram, sicut promiserat, et implevi Saræ, quæ locutus est; concepitque et peperit Abrahæ filium in senectute eius tempore, quo prædixerat ei Deus.

column2: And Abraham called the name of his son, whom Sara bore him, Isaac.
column4: Vocavitque Abraham nomen filii sui, quem genuit ei Sara, Isaac.

column2: And he circumcised him the eighth day, as God had commanded him.
column4: Et circumcidit eum octavo die, sicut præceperat ei Deus.

column2: When he was a hundred years old: for at this age of his father, was Isaac born.
column4: Cum Abraham centum esset annorum, natus est ei Isaac filius eius.

column2: And Sara said: God hath made a laughter for me: whosoever shall hear of it will laugh with me.
column4: Dixitque Sara: Risum fecit mihi Deus; quicumque audierit, corridebit mihi.

column2: And again she said: Who would believe that Abraham should hear that Sara gave suck to a son, whom she bore to him in his old age?
column4: Rursumque ait: Quis auditurum crederet Abraham quod Sara lacteret filios, quia peperit ei filium iam seni?

column2: And the child grew, and was weaned: and Abraham made a great feast on the day of his weaning.
column4: Crevit igitur puer et ablactatus est. Fecitque Abraham grande convivium in die ablactationis eius.

column2: And when Sara had seen the son of Agar, the Egyptian, playing with Isaac, her son, she said to Abraham: Cast out this bondwoman and her son; for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with my son Isaac.
column4: Cumque vidisset Sara filium Agar Aegyptiæ iocantem cum Isaac filio suo, dixit ad Abraham: Eice ancillam hanc et filium eius; non enim erit heres filius ancillæ cum filio meo Isaac.

column2: Abraham took this grievously for his son.
column4: Dure accepit hoc Abraham propter filium suum.

column2: And God said to him: Let it not seem grievous to thee for the boy, and for thy bondwoman: in all that Sara hath said to thee, hearken to her voice: for in Isaac shall thy seed be called.
column4: Cui dixit Deus: Non tibi videatur asperum super puero et super ancilla tua; omnia, quæ dixerit tibi Sara, audi vocem eius, quia in Isaac vocabitur tibi semen.

column2: But I will make the son also of the bondwoman a great nation, because he is thy seed.
column4: Sed et filium ancillæ faciam in gentem magnam, quia semen tuum est.

column2: So Abraham rose up in the morning, and taking bread and a bottle of water, put it upon her shoulder, and delivered the boy, and sent her away. And she departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Bersabee.
column4: Surrexit itaque Abraham mane et tollens panem et utrem aquæ imposuit scapulæ eius tradiditque puerum et dimisit eam. Quæ cum abisset, errabat in deserto Bersabee.

column2: And when the water in the bottle was spent, she cast the boy under one of the trees that were there. And she went her way, and sat over against him a great way off, as far as a bow can carry, for she said: I will not see the boy die: and sitting over against, she lifted up her voice and wept.
column4: Cumque consumpta esset aqua in utre, abiecit puerum subter unum arbustum et abiit; seditque e regione procul, quantum potest arcus iacere. Dixit enim: "Non videbo morientem puerum". Et sedens contra levavit vocem suam et flevit.

column2: And God heard the voice of the boy: and an angel of God called to Agar from heaven, saying: What art thou doing, Agar? fear not; for God hath heard the voice of the boy, from the place wherein he is.
column4: Exaudivit autem Deus vocem pueri; vocavitque angelus Dei Agar de cælo dicens: Quid tibi, Agar? Noli timere; exaudivit enim Deus vocem pueri de loco, in quo est.

column2: Arise, take up the boy, and hold him by the hand, for I will make him a great nation.
column4: Surge, tolle puerum et tene illum manu tua, quia in gentem magnam faciam eum.

column2: And God opened her eyes: and she saw a well of water, and went and filled the bottle, and gave the boy to drink.
column4: Aperuitque Deus oculos eius; quæ videns puteum aquæ abiit et implevit utrem deditque puero bibere.

column2: And God was with him: and he grew, and dwelt in the wilderness, and became a young man, an archer.
column4: Et fuit Deus cum eo; qui crevit et moratus est in solitudine factusque est iuvenis sagittarius.

column2: And he dwelt in the wilderness of Pharan, and his mother took a wife for him out of the land of Egypt.
column4: Habitavitque in deserto Pharan; et accepit illi mater sua uxorem de terra Aegypti.

column2: At the same time Abimelech, and Phicol the general of his army, said to Abraham: God is with thee in all that thou dost.
column4: Eodem tempore dixit Abimelech et Phicol princeps exercitus eius ad Abraham: Deus tecum est in universis, quæ agis.

column2: Swear therefore by God, that thou wilt not hurt me, nor my posterity, nor my stock: but according to the kindness that I have done to thee, thou shalt do to me, and to the land wherein thou hast lived a stranger.
column4: Iura ergo per Deum, ne noceas mihi et posteris meis stirpique meæ; sed iuxta fidem, quam feci tibi, facies mihi et terræ, in qua versatus es advena.

column2: And Abraham said: I will swear.
And he reproved Abimelech for a well of water, which his servants had taken away by force.
column4: Et increpavit Abraham Abimelech propter puteum aquæ, quem vi abstulerant servi eius.

column2: And Abimelech answered: I knew not who did this thing: and thou didst not tell me, and I heard not of it till today.
column4: Responditque Abimelech: Nescivi quis fecerit hanc rem; sed et tu non indicasti mihi, et ego non audivi præter hodie.

column2: Then Abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them to Abimelech: and both of them made a league.
column4: Tulit itaque Abraham oves et boves et dedit Abimelech; percusseruntque ambo fœdus.

column2: And Abraham set apart seven ewelambs of the flock. And Abimelech said to him: What mean these seven ewelambs which thou hast set apart?
column4: Et statuit Abraham septem agnas gregis seorsum. Cui dixit Abimelech: Quid sibi volunt septem agnæ istæ, quas stare fecisti seorsum?

column2: But he said: Thou shalt take seven ewelambs at my hand: that they may be a testimony for me, that I dug this well.
column4: At ille: Septem, inquit, agnas accipies de manu mea, ut sint in testimonium mihi, quoniam ego fodi puteum istum.

column2: Therefore that place was called Bersabee; because there both of them did swear.
column4: Idcirco vocatus est locus ille Bersabee, quia uterque iuraverunt.

column2: And they made a league for the well of oath. And Abimelech and Phicol, the general of his army, arose and returned to the land of the Palestines.
column4: Et inierunt fœdus in Bersabee. Surrexit autem Abimelech et Phicol princeps militiæ eius reversique sunt in terram Philisthim.

column2: But Abraham planted a grove in Bersabee, and there called upon the name of the Lord God eternal.
column4: Abrahm vero plantavit nemus in Bersabee et invocavit ibi nomem Domini, Dei æterni.

column2: And he was a sojourner in the land of the Palestines many days.
column4: Et fuit colonus in terra Philisthim diebus multis.

column2: After these things, God tempted Abraham, and said to him: Abraham, Abraham. And he answered: Here I am.
column4: Quæ postquam gesta sunt, tentavit Deus Abaham et dixit ad eum: "Abraham". Ille respondit: "Adsum".

column2: He said to him: Take thy only begotten son Isaac, whom thou lovest, and go into the land of vision; and there thou shalt offer him for an holocaust upon one of the mountains which I will shew thee.
column4: Ait: Tolle filium tuum unigenitum, quem diligis, Isaac et vade in terram Moria; atque offer eum ibi in holocaustum super unum montium, quem monstravero tibi.

column2: So Abraham rising up in the night, saddled his ass, and took with him two young men, and Isaac his son: and when he had cut wood for the holocaust, he went his way to the place which God had commanded him.
column4: Igitur Abraham de nocte consurgens stravit asinum suum ducens secum duos iuvenes suos et Isaac filium suum. Cumque concidisset ligna in holocaustum, surrexit et abiit ad locum, quem præceperat ei Deus.

column2: And on the third day, lifting up his eyes, he saw the place afar off. And he said to his young men: Stay you here with the ass; I and the boy will go with speed as far as yonder, and after we have worshipped, will return to you.
column4: Die autem tertio, elevatis oculis, vidit locum procul dixitque ad pueros suos: Exspectate hic cum asino. Ego et puer illuc usque properantes, postquam adoraverimus, revertemur ad vos.

column2: And he took the wood for the holocaust, and laid it upon Isaac his son; and he himself carried in his hands fire and a sword.
column4: Tulit quoque ligna holocausti et imposuit super Isaac filium suum; ipse vero portabat in manibus ignem et cultrum.

column2: And as they two went on together, Isaac said to his father: My father. And he answered: What wilt thou, son? Behold, saith he, fire and wood: where is the victim for the holocaust?
column4: Cumque duo pergerent simul, dixit Isaac Abrahæ patri suo: "Pater mi". Ille respondit: "Quid vis, fili?" "Ecce, inquit, ignis et ligna; ubi est victima holocausti?"

column2: And Abraham said: God will provide himself a victim for an holocaust, my son. So they went on together.
column4: Dixit Abraham: "Deus providebit sibi victimam holocausti, fili mi". Pergebant ambo pariter.

column2: And they came to the place which God had shewn him, where he built an altar, and laid the wood in order upon it; and when he had bound Isaac his son, he laid him on the altar upon the pile of wood.
column4: Et venerunt ad locum, quem ostenderat ei Deus, in quo ædificavit Abraham altare et desuper ligna composuit. Cumque colligasset Isaac filium suum, posuit eum in altari super struem lignorum.

column2: And he put forth his hand, and took the sword, to sacrifice his son.
column4: Extenditque Abraham manum et arripuit cultrum, ut immolaret filium suum.

column2: And behold, an angel of the Lord from heaven called to him, saying: Abraham, Abraham. And he answered: Here I am.
column4: Et ecce angelus Domini de cælo clamavit: "Abraham, Abraham". Qui respondit: "Adsum".

column2: And he said to him: Lay not thy hand upon the boy, neither do thou any thing to him: now I know that thou fearest God, and hast not spared thy only begotten son for my sake.
column4: Dixitque: Non extendas manum tuam super puerum neque facias illi quidquam. Nunc cognovi quod times Deum et non pepercisti filio tuo unigenito propter me.

column2: Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw behind his back a ram, amongst the briers, sticking fast by the horns, which he took and offered for a holocaust instead of his son.
column4: Levavit Abraham oculos suos viditque arietem unum inter vepres hærentem cornibus; quem assumens obtulit holocaustum pro filo.

column2: And he called the name of that place, The Lord seeth. Whereupon, even to this day, it is said: In the mountain the Lord will see.
column4: Appellavitque nomen loci illius: "Dominus videt". Unde usque hodie dicitur: "In monte Dominus videtur".

column2: And the angel of the Lord called to Abraham a second time from heaven, saying: By my own self have I sworn, saith the Lord: because thou hast done this thing, and hast not spared thy only begotten son for my sake: I will bless thee, and I will multiply thy seed as the stars of heaven, and as the sand that is by the sea shore; thy seed shall possess the gates of their enemies. And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed, because thou hast obeyed my voice.
column4: Vocavit autem angelus Domini Abraham secundo de cælo et dixit: "Per metipsum iuravi, dicit Dominus: quia fecisti hanc rem et non pepercisti filio tuo unigenito, benedicam tibi et multiplicabo semen tuum sicut stellas cæli et velut arenam, quæ est in litore maris. Possidebit semen tuum portas inimicorum suorum, et benedicentur en semine tuo omnes gentes terræ, quia obœdisti voci meæ".

column2: Abraham returned to his young men, and they went to Bersabee together, and he dwelt there.
column4: Reversus est Abraham ad pueros suos, et surrexerunt abieruntque Bersabee simul, et habitavit Abraham in Bersabee.

column2: And Sara lived a hundred and twenty-seven years.
column4: Vixit autem Sara centum viginti septem annis.

column2: And she died in the city of Arbee which is Hebron, in the land of Canaan: and Abraham came to mourn and weep for her.
column4: Et mortua est in Cariatharbe, quæ est Hebron, in terra Chanaan; venitque Abraham, ut plangeret et fleret eam.

column2: And after he rose up from the funeral obsequies, he spoke to the children of Heth, saying: I am a stranger and sojourner among you: give me the right of a burying place with you, that I may bury my dead.
column4: Cumque surrexisset ab officio funeris, locutus est ad filios Heth dicens: “Advena sum et inquilinus apud vos; date mihi possessionem sepulcri vobiscum, ut sepeliam mortuum meum”.

column2: The children of Heth answered, saying: My lord, hear us, thou art a prince of God among us: bury thy dead in our principal sepulchres: and no man shall have power to hinder thee from burying thy dead in his sepulchre.
column4: Responderunt filii Heth dicentes: Audi nos, domine, princeps Dei es apud nos: in nobilissimo sepulcrorum nostrorum sepeli mortuum tuum; nullusque te prohibebit, quin in sepulcro eius sepelias mortuum tuum.

column2: Abraham rose up, and bowed down to the people of the land, to wit, the children of Heth: And said to them: If it please your soul that I should bury my dead, hear me, and intercede for me to Ephron the son of Seor. That he may give me the double cave, which he hath in the end of his field: For as much money as it is worth he shall give it me before you, for a possession of a burying place.
column4: Surrexit Abraham et adoravit populum terræ, filios videlicet Heth, dixitque ad eos: Si placet animæ vestræ, ut sepeliam mortuum meum, audite me et intercedite pro me apud Ephron filium Seor, ut det mihi speluncam Machpela, quam habet in extrema parte agri sui. Pecunia digna tradat eam mihi coram vobis in possessionem sepulcri.

column2: Now Ephron dwelt in the midst of the children of Heth. And Ephron made answer to Abraham in the hearing of all that went in at the gate of the city, saying: Let it not be so, my lord, but do thou rather hearken to what I say: The field I deliver to thee, and the cave that is therein; in the presence of the children of my people, bury thy dead.
column4: Sedebat autem Ephron in medio filiorum Heth. Responditque Ephron Hetthæus ad Abraham, filiis Heth audientibus cunctis, qui ingrediebantur portam civitatis illius, dicens: Nequaquam ita fiat, domine mi, ausculta me. Agrum do tibi et speluncam, quæ in eo est, præsentibus filiis populi mei; sepeli mortuum tuum.

column2: Abraham bowed down before the people of the land. And he spoke to Ephron, in the presence of the people: I beseech thee to hear me: I will give money for the field; take it, and so will I bury my dead in it.
column4: Adoravit Abraham coram populo terræ et locutus est ad Ephron, audiente populo terræ: Quæso, ut audias me. Dabo pecuniam pro agro; suscipe eam, et sic sepeliam mortuum meum in eo.

column2: And Ephron answered: My lord, hear me. The ground which thou desirest, is worth four hundred sicles of silver: this is the price between me and thee: but what is this? bury thy dead.
column4: Respondit Ephron ad Abraham dicens ei: Domine mi, audi me. Terra quadringentorum siclorum argenti inter me et te quid est hoc? Sepeli mortuum tuum.

column2: And when Abraham had heard this, he weighed out the money that Ephron had asked, in the hearing of the children of Heth, four hundred sicles of silver, of common current money.
column4: Auscultavit Abraham Ephron et appendit pecuniam, quam Ephron postulaverat, audientibus filiis Heth, quadringentos siclos argenti, sicut mos erat apud negotiatores.

column2: And the field that before was Ephron's, wherein was the double cave, looking towards Mambre, both it and the cave, and all the trees thereof, in all its limits round about, was made sure to Abraham for a possession, in the sight of the children of Heth, and of all that went in at the gate of his city.
column4: Confirmatusque est ager Ephronis, qui erat in Machpela respiciens Mambre, tam ipse quam spelunca in eo et omnes arbores eius in cunctis terminis eius per circuitum, Abrahæ in possessionem, videntibus filiis Heth cunctis, qui intrabant portam civitatis illius.

column2: And so Abraham buried Sara, his wife, in the double cave of the field, that looked towards Mambre, this is Hebron in the land of Canaan.
column4: Deinde sepelivit Abraham Saram uxorem suam in spelunca agri Machpela, qui respiciebat Mambre hæc est Hebron­ in terra Chanaan.

column2: And the field was made sure to Abraham, and the cave that was in it, for a possession to bury in, by the children of Heth.
column4: Et confirmatus est ager et antrum, quod erat in eo, Abrahae in possessionem sepulcri a filiis Heth.

column2: Now Abraham was old, and advanced in age; and the Lord had blessed him in all things.
column4: Erat autem Abraham senex dierumque multorum; et Dominus in cunctis benedixerat ei.

column2: And he said to the elder servant of his house, who was ruler over all he had: Put thy hand under my thigh, that I may make thee swear by the Lord, the God of heaven and earth, that thou take not a wife for my son, of the daughters of the Chanaanites, among whom I dwell: but that thou go to my own country and kindred, and take a wife from thence for my son Isaac.
column4: Dixitque Abraham ad servum seniorem domus suæ, qui præerat omnibus, quæ habebat: Pone manum tuam subter femur meum, ut adiurem te per Dominum, Deum cæli et Deum terræ, ut non accipias uxorem filio meo de filiabus Chananæorum, inter quos habito; sed ad terram et cognationem meam proficiscaris et inde accipias uxorem filio meo Isaac.

column2: The servant answered: If the woman will not come with me into this land, must I bring thy son back again to the place from whence thou camest out?
column4: Respondit servus: Si noluerit mulier venire mecum in terram hanc, num reducere debeo filium tuum ad terram, a quo tu egressus es?

column2: And Abraham said: Beware thou never bring my son back again thither.
column4: Dixit Abraham: Cave, ne quando reducas illuc filium meum.

column2: The Lord God of heaven, who took me out of my father's house, and out of my native country, who spoke to me, and swore to me, saying: To thy seed will I give this land: he will send his angel before thee, and thou shalt take from thence a wife for my son.
column4: Dominus, Deus cæli, qui tulit me de domo patris mei et de terra nativitatis meæ, qui locutus est mihi et iuravit mihi dicens: "Semini tuo dabo terram hanc", ipse mittet angelum suum coram te, et accipies inde uxorem filio meo.

column2: But if the woman will not follow thee, thou shalt not be bound by the oath: only bring not my son back thither again.
column4: Sin autem noluerit mulier sequi te, non teneberis iuramento; filium tantum meum ne reducas illuc.

column2: The servant, therefore, put his hand under the thigh of Abraham, his lord, and swore to him upon his word.
column4: Posuit ergo servus manum sub femore Abraham domini sui et iuravit illi super hac re.

column2: And he took ten camels of his master's herd, and departed, carrying something of all his goods with him, and he set forward and went on to Mesopotamia, to the city of Nachor.
column4: Tulitque servus decem camelos de grege domini sui et abiit ex omnibus bonis eius portans secum; profectusque perrexit in Aram Naharaim ad urbem Nachor.

column2: And when he had made the camels lie down without the town, near a well of water, in the evening, at the time when women are wont to come out to draw water, he said: O Lord, the God of my master, Abraham, meet me today, I beseech thee, and shew kindness to my master, Abraham.
column4: Cumque camelos fecisset accumbere extra oppidum iuxta puteum aquæ vespere, tempore quo solent mulieres egredi ad hauriendam aquam, dixit: Domine, Deus domini mei Abraham, occurre obsecro mihi hodie et fac misericordiam cum domino meo Abraham.

column2: Behold, I stand nigh the spring of water, and the daughters of the inhabitants of this city will come out to draw water.
column4: Ecce ego sto prope fontem aquæ, et filiæ habitatorum huius civitatis egredientur ad hauriendam aquam.

column2: Now, therefore, the maid to whom I shall say: Let down thy pitcher that I may drink: and she shall answer, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: let it be the same whom thou hast provided for thy servant Isaac: and by this, I shall understand that thou hast shewn kindness to my master.
column4: Igitur puella, cui ego dixero: "Inclina hydriam tuam, ut bibam", et illa responderit: "Bibe, quin et camelis tuis dabo potum", ipsa est, quam præparasti servo tuo Isaac, et per hoc intellegam quod feceris misericordiam cum domino meo.

column2: He had not yet ended these words within himself, and behold Rebecca came out, the daughter of Bathuel, son of Melcha, wife to Nachor the brother of Abraham, having a pitcher on her shoulder.
column4: Necdum intra se verba compleverat, et ecce Rebecca egrediebatur filia Bathuel filii Melchæ uxoris Nachor fratris Abraham habens hydriam in scapula.

column2: An exceeding comely maid, and a most beautiful virgin, and not known to man: and she went down to the spring, and filled her pitcher, and was coming back.
column4: Puella decora nimis, virgo et incognita viro. Descendit ad fontem et implevit hydriam ac revertebatur.

column2: And the servant ran to meet her, and said: Give me a little water to drink of thy pitcher.
column4: Occurritque ei servus et ait: Pauxillum mihi ad sorbendum præbe aquæ de hydria tua.

column2: And she answered: Drink, my lord. And quickly she let down the pitcher upon her arm, and gave him drink.
column4: Quæ respondit: “Bibe, domine mi”. Celeriterque deposuit hydriam super ulnam suam et dedit ei potum.

column2: And when he had drunk, she said: I will draw water for thy camels also, till they all drink.
column4: Cumque ille bibisset, adiecit: Quin et camelis tuis hauriam aquam, donec cuncti bibant.

column2: And pouring out the pitcher into the troughs, she ran back to the well to draw water; and having drawn, she gave to all the camels.
column4: Effundensque hydriam in canalibus recurrit ad puteum, ut hauriret aquam; et haustam omnibus camelis dedit.

column2: But he musing, beheld her with silence, desirous to know whether the Lord had made his journey prosperous or not.
column4: Ille autem contemplabatur eam tacitus, scire volens utrum prosperum fecisset iter suum Dominus an non.

column2: And after that the camels had drunk, the man took out golden earrings, weighing two sicles; and as many bracelets, of ten sicles weight. And he said to her: Whose daughter art thou? tell me: is there any place in thy father's house to lodge?
column4: Postquam ergo biberunt cameli, protulit vir anulum aureum pondo dimidii sicli pro naribus et duas armillas pro manibus eius pondo siclorum decem; dixitque: Cuius es filia? lndica mihi. Est in domo patris tui locus nobis ad pernoctandum?

column2: And she answered: I am the daughter of Bathuel, the son of Melcha, whom she bore to Nachor.
column4: Quæ respondit: Filia Bathuelis sum filii Melchæ, quem peperit Nachor.

column2: And she said, moreover, to him: We have good store of both straw and hay, and a large place to lodge in.
column4: Et addidit dicens: Palearum quoque et pabuli plurimum est apud nos et locus ad pernoctandum.

column2: The man bowed himself down, and adored the Lord, saying: Blessed be the Lord God of my master Abraham, who hath not taken away his mercy and truth from my master, and hath brought me the straight way into the house of my master's brother.
column4: Inclinavit se homo et adoravit Dominum dicens: Benedictus Dominus, Deus domini mei Abraham, qui non abstulit misericordiam et veritatem suam a domino meo et recto itinere me perduxit in domum fratris domini mei.

column2: Then the maid ran, and told in her mother's house all that she had heard.
column4: Cucurrit itaque puella et nuntiavit in domum matris suæ omnia, quæ evenerant.

column2: And Rebecca had a brother, named Laban, who went out in haste to the man, to the well. And when he had seen the earrings and bracelets in his sister's hands, and had heard all that she related, saying, Thus and thus the man spoke to me: he came to the man who stood by the camels, and near to the spring of water, and said to him: Come in, thou blessed of the Lord; why standest thou without? I have prepared the house, and a place for the camels.
column4: Habebat autem Rebecca fratrem nomine Laban, qui festinus egressus est ad hominem, ubi erat fons. Cumque vidisset anulum in naribus et armillas in manibus sororis suæ et audisset cuncta verba referentis: “Hæc locutus est mihi homo”, venit ad virum, qui stabat iuxta camelos et prope fontem aquæ; dixitque ad eum: “Ingredere, benedicte Domini, cur foris stas? Præparavi domum et locum camelis”.

column2: And he brought him into his lodging; and he unharnessed the camels, and gave straw and hay, and water to wash his feet, and the feet of the men that were come with him.
column4: Et introduxit eum in hospitium ac destravit camelos; deditque paleas et pabulum camelis et aquam ad lavandos pedes eius et virorum, qui venerant cum eo.

column2: And bread was set before him. But he said: I will not eat, till I tell my message. He answered him: Speak.
column4: Et apposuit in conspectu eius panem. Qui ait: "Non comedam, donec loquar sermones meos”. Respondit: “Loquere”.

column2: And he said: I am the servant of Abraham. And the Lord hath blessed my master wonderfully, and he is become great: and he hath given him sheep and oxen, silver and gold, men servants and women servants, camels and asses.
column4: At ille: Servus, inquit, Abraham sum; et Dominus benedixit domino meo valde, magnificatusque est; et dedit ei oves et boves, argentum et aurum, servos et ancillas, camelos et asinos.

column2: And Sara, my master's wife, hath borne my master a son in her old age, and he hath given him all that he had.
column4: Et peperit Sara uxor domini mei filium domino meo in senectute sua; deditque illi omnia, quæ habuerat.

column2: And my master made me swear, saying: Thou shalt not take a wife for my son of the Chanaanites, in whose land I dwell: but thou shalt go to my father's house, and shalt take a wife of my own kindred for my son.
column4: Et adiuravit me dominus meus dicens: Non accipies uxorem filio meo de filiabus Chananæorum, in quorum terra habito; sed ad domum patris mei perges et de cognatione mea accipies uxorem filio meo.

column2: But I answered my master: What if the woman will not come with me?
column4: Ego vero respondi domino meo: Quid, si noluerit venire mecum mulier?

column2: The Lord, said he, in whose sight I walk, will send his angel with thee, and will direct thy way: and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my own kindred, and of my father's house. But thou shalt be clear from my curse, when thou shalt come to my kindred, if they will not give thee one.
column4: Dominus, ait, in cuius conspectu ambulo, mittet angelum suum tecum et diriget viam tuam; accipiesque uxorem filio meo de cognatione mea et de domo patris mei. Innocens eris a maledictione mea, cum veneris ad propinquos meos, et non dederint tibi; tunc innocens eris a maledictione mea.

column2: And I came today to the well of water, and said: O Lord God of my master, Abraham, if thou hast prospered my way, wherein I now walk, behold, I stand by the well of water, and the virgin, that shall come out to draw water, who shall hear me say: Give me a little water to drink of thy pitcher: and shall say to me: Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels: let the same be the woman, whom the Lord hath prepared for my master's son.
column4: Veni ergo hodie ad fontem et dixi: Domine, Deus domini mei Abraham, si direxisti viam meam, in qua nunc ambulo, ecce sto iuxta fontem aquæ; et virgo, quæ egredietur ad hauriendam aquam, audierit a me: "Da mihi pauxillum aquæ ad bibendum ex hydria tua"; et dixerit mihi: "Et tu bibe, et camelis tuis hauriam", ipsa est mulier, quam præparavit Dominus filio domini mei.

column2: And whilst I pondered these things secretly with myself, Rebecca appeared, coming with a pitcher, which she carried on her shoulder: and she went down to the well and drew water. And I said to her: Give me a little to drink.
column4: Dum hæc tacitus mecum volverem, apparuit Rebecca veniens cum hydria, quam portabat in scapula; descenditque ad fontem et hausit aquam. Et aio ad eam: Da mihi paululum bibere.

column2: And she speedily let down the pitcher from her shoulder, and said to me: Both drink thou, and to thy camels I will give drink. I drank, and she watered the camels.
column4: Quæ festina deposuit hydriam de umero et dixit mihi: "Et tu bibe, et camelis tuis potum tribuam". Bibi, et adaquavit camelos.

column2: And I asked her, and said: Whose daughter art thou? And she answered: I am the daughter of Bathuel, the son of Nachor, whom Melcha bore to him. So I put earrings on her to adorn her face, and I put bracelets on her hands.
column4: Interrogavique eam et dixi: Cuius es filia? Quæ respondit: "Filia Bathuelis sum filii Nachor, quem peperit illi Melcha". Suspendi itaque anulum in naribus eius et armillas posui in manibus eius.

column2: Wherefore, if you do according to mercy and truth with my master, tell me: but if it please you otherwise, tell me that also, that I may go to the right hand, or to the left.
column4: Quam ob rem, si facitis misericordiam et veritatem cum domino meo, indicate mihi; sin autem aliud placet, et hoc dicite mihi, ut vadam ad dexteram sive ad sinistram.

column2: And falling down, I adored the Lord, blessing the Lord God of my master, Abraham, who hath brought me the straight way to take the daughter of my master's brother for his son.
column4: Pronusque adoravi Dominum benedicens Domino, Deo domini mei Abraham, qui perduxit me recto itinere, ut sumerem filiam fratris domini mei filio eius.

column2: And Laban and Bathuel answered: The word hath proceeded from the Lord: we cannot speak any other thing to thee but his pleasure.
column4: Responderunt Laban et Bathuel: A Domino egressus est sermo; non possumus extra placitum eius quidquam aliud loqui tecum.

column2: Behold, Rebecca is before thee, take her and go thy way, and let her be the wife of thy master's son, as the Lord hath spoken.
column4: En Rebecca coram te est; tolle eam et proficiscere, et sit uxor filii domini tui, sicut locutus est Dominus.

column2: Which when Abraham's servant heard, falling down to the ground, he adored the Lord.
column4: Quod cum audisset puer Abraham, procidens adoravit in terram Dominum.

column2: And bringing forth vessels of silver and gold, and garments, he gave them to Rebecca, for a present. He offered gifts also to her brothers, and to her mother.
column4: Prolatisque vasis argenteis et aureis ac vestibus, dedit ea Rebeccæ; res pretiosas dedit fratri eius et matri.

column2: And a banquet was made, and they ate and drank together, and lodged there. And in the morning, the servant arose, and said: Let me depart, that I may go to my master.
column4: Tunc comederunt et biberunt ipse et viri, qui erant cum eo, et pernoctaverunt ibi. Surgens autem mane locutus est puer: Dimittite me, ut vadam ad dominum meum.

column2: And her brother and mother answered: Let the maid stay, at least, ten days with us, and afterwards she shall depart.
column4: Responderuntque frater eius et mater: Maneat puella saltem decem dies apud nos et postea proficiscetur.

column2: Stay me not, said he, because the Lord hath prospered my way: send me away, that I may go to my master.
column4: Nolite, ait, me retinere, quia Dominus direxit viam meam; dimittite me, ut pergam ad dominum meum.

column2: And they said: Let us call the maid, and ask her will.
column4: Dixerunt: Vocemus puellam et quæramus ipsius voluntatem.

column2: And they called her, and when she was come, they asked: Wilt thou go with this man? She said: I will go.
column4: Cumque vocata venisset, sciscitati sunt: “Vis ire cum homine isto?” Quæ ait: "Vadam".

column2: So they sent her away, and her nurse, and Abraham's servant, servant, and his company, wishing prosperity to their sister, and saying: Thou art our sister, mayst thou increase to thousands of thousands; and may thy seed possess the gates of their enemies.
column4: Dimiserunt ergo Rebeccam sororem eorum et nutricem illius servumque Abraham et comites eius, imprecantes prospera sorori suæ atque dicentes: Soror nostra es, crescas in mille milia, et possideat semen tuum portas inimicorum suorum!

column2: So Rebecca and her maids, being set upon camels, followed the man: who with speed returned to his master.
column4: Igitur surrexit Rebecca et puellæ illius et, ascensis camelis, secutæ sunt virum; sumpsitque servus Rebeccam et abiit.

column2: At the same time, Isaac was walking along the way to the well which is called Of the living and the seeing: for he dwelt in the south country.
column4: Isaac autem venerat a regione putei Lahairoi et habitabat in terra Nageb.

column2: And he was gone forth to meditate in the field, the day being now well spent: and when he had lifted up his eyes, he saw camels coming afar off.
column4: Et egressus est Isaac ad lamentandum in agro, inclinata iam die. Cumque levasset oculos, vidit camelos venientes.

column2: Rebecca also, when she saw Isaac, lighted off the camel, and said to the servant: Who is that man who cometh towards us along the field? And he said to her: That man is my master. But she quickly took her cloak, and covered herself.
column4: Rebecca quoque levavit oculos et vidit Isaac; descenditque de camelo et ait ad puerum: “Quis est ille homo, qui venit per agrum in occursum nobis?” Dixitque ei: “Ipse est dominus meus”. At illa tollens cito velum operuit se.

column2: And the servant told Isaac all that he had done, who brought her into the tent of Sara his mother, and took her to wife: and he loved her so much, that it moderated the sorrow which was occasioned by his mother's death.
column4: Servus autem cuncta, quæ gesserat, narravit Isaac; qui introduxit eam in tabernaculum Saræ matris suæ et accepit Rebeccam uxorem; et dilexit eam et consolatus est a morte matris suæ.

column2: And the days of Abraham's life were a hundred and seventy-five years.
column4: Fuerunt autem dies vitæ Abrahæ centum septuaginta quinque anni.

column2: And decaying he died in a good old age, and having lived a long time, and being full of days: and was gathered to his people.
column4: Et deficiens mortuus est Abraham in senectute bona provectæque ætatis et plenus dierum congregatusque est ad populum suum.

column2: And Isaac and Ismael his sons buried him in the double cave, which was situated in the field of Ephron the son of Seor the Hethite, over against Mambre, which he had bought of the children of Heth: there was he buried, and Sara his wife.
column4: Et sepelierunt eum Isaac et Ismael filii sui in spelunca Machpela, quæ sita est in agro Ephron filii Seor Hetthæi e regione Mambre, quem emerat a filiis Heth. Ibi sepultus est ipse et Sara uxor eius.

column2: And after his death, God blessed Isaac his son, who dwelt by the well named Of the living and seeing.
column4: Et post obitum illius benedixit Deus Isaac filio eius, qui habitabat iuxta puteum Lahairoi.

column2: And Isaac besought the Lord for his wife, because she was barren: and he heard him, and made Rebecca to conceive.
column4: Deprecatusque est Isaac Dominum pro uxore sua, eo quod esset sterilis. Qui exaudivit eum et dedit conceptum Rebeccæ.

column2: But the children struggled in her womb, and she said: If it were to be so with me, what need was there to conceive? And she went to consult the Lord.
column4: Sed collidebantur in utero eius parvuli. Quæ ait: “Si sic est, cur mihi?” Perrexitque, ut consuleret Dominum.

column2: And he answering, said: Two nations are in thy womb, and two peoples shall be divided out of thy womb, and one people shall overcome the other, and the elder shall serve the younger.
column4: Qui respondens ait: Duæ gentes sunt in utero tuo, et duo populi ex ventre tuo dividentur; populusque populum superabit, et maior serviet minori.

column2: And when her time was come to be delivered, behold twins were found in her womb.
column4: Iam tempus pariendi venerat, et ecce gemini in utero eius.

column2: He that came forth first was red, and hairy like a skin: and his name was called Esau.
column4: Qui primus egressus est rufus erat et totus quasi pallium pilosum; vocatumque est nomen eius Esau.

column2: Immediately the other coming forth, held his brother's foot in his hand: and therefore he was called Jacob.
column4: Postea frater eius egrediens plantam Esau tenebat manu, et idcirco appellatum est nomen eius Iacob.

column2: Isaac was threescore years old when the children were born unto him.
column4: Sexagenarius erat Isaac, quando nati sunt parvuli.

column2: And when they were grown up, Esau became a skilful hunter, and a husbandman: but Jacob, a plain man, dwelt in tents.
column4: Quibus adultis, factus est Esau vir gnarus venandi et homo agrestis; Iacob autem vir compositus et habitans in tabernaculis.

column2: Isaac loved Esau, because he ate of his hunting: and Rebecca loved Jacob.
column4: Isaac amabat Esau, eo quod de venationibus illius libenter vesceretur; et Rebecca diligebat Iacob.

column2: And Jacob boiled pottage: to whom Esau, coming faint out of the field, said: Give me of this red pottage, for I am exceeding faint. For which reason his name was called Edom.
column4: Coxit autem Iacob pulmentum; ad quem, cum venisset Esau de agro lassus, ait: “Da mihi de coctione hac rufa, quia oppido lassus sum”. Quam ob causam vocatum est nomen eius Edom (id est Rufus).

column2: And Jacob said to him: Sell me thy first birthright.
column4: Cui dixit Iacob: Vende mihi prius primogenita tua.

column2: He answered: Lo I die, what will the first birthright avail me?
column4: Ille respondit: En morior; quid mihi proderunt primogenita?

column2: Jacob said: Swear therefore to me. Esau swore to him, and sold his first birthright.
column4: Ait Iacob: “Iura ergo mihi”. Iuravit et vendidit primogenita.

column2: And so taking bread and the pottage of lentils, he ate, and drank, and went on his way; making little account of having sold his first birthright.
column4: Et sic, accepto pane et lentis edulio, comedit et bibit; surrexit et abiit parvipendens quod primogenita vendidisset.

column2: And when a famine came in the land, after that barrenness which had happened in the days of Abraham, Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Palestines, to Gerara.
column4: Orta autem fame super terram post eam sterilitatem, quæ acciderat in diebus Abraham, abiit Isaac ad Abimelech regem Philisthim in Gerara.

column2: And the Lord appeared to him, and said: Go not down into Egypt, but stay in the land that I shall tell thee.
column4: Apparuitque ei Dominus et ait: Ne descendas in Aegyptum, sed habita in terra, quam dixero tibi.

column2: And sojourn in it, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee: for to thee and to thy seed I will give all these countries, to fulfil the oath which I swore to Abraham thy father.
column4: Et peregrinare in ea; eroque tecum et benedicam tibi. Tibi enim et semini tuo dabo universas regiones has complens iuramentum, quod spopondi Abraham patri tuo.

column2: And I will multiply thy seed like the stars of heaven: and I will give to thy posterity all these countries: and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed, because Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my precepts and commandments, and observed my ceremonies and laws.
column4: Et multiplicabo semen tuum sicut stellas cæli daboque posteris tuis universas regiones has; et benedicentur in semine tuo omnes gentes terræ, eo quod obœdierit Abraham voci meæ et custodierit præcepta et mandata mea et iustificationes legesque servaverit.

column2: And when he was asked by the men of that place, concerning his wife, he answered: She is my sister: for he was afraid to confess that she was his wife, thinking lest perhaps they would kill him because of her beauty.
column4: Qui, cum interrogaretur a viris loci illius super uxore sua, respondit: “Soror mea est”. Timuerat enim confiteri quod sibi esset sociata coniugio, reputans ne forte interficerent eum propter illius pulchritudinem.

column2: And when very many days were passed, and he abode there, Abimelech, king of the Palestines, looking out through a window, saw him playing with Rebecca, his wife.
column4: Cumque pertransissent dies plurimi et ibidem moraretur, prospiciens Abimelech rex Philisthim per fenestram vidit eum iocantem cum Rebecca uxore sua.

column2: And calling for him, he said: It is evident she is thy wife: why didst thou feign her to be thy sister? He answered: I feared lest I should die for her sake.
column4: Et, accersito eo, ait: “Perspicuum est quod uxor tua sit; cur mentitus es eam sororem tuam esse?” Respondit: “Timui, ne morerer propter eam”.

column2: And Abimelech said: Why hast thou deceived us? Some man of the people might have lain with thy wife, and thou hadst brought upon us a great sin.
column4: Dixitque Abimelech: Quare hoc fecisti nobis? Potuit coire quispiam de populo cum uxore tua, et induxeras super nos grande peccatum.

column2: And he commanded all the people, saying: He that shall touch this man's wife, shall surely be put to death.
column4: Præcepitque omni populo dicens: Qui tetigerit hominem hunc et uxorem eius, morte morietur.

column2: And Isaac sowed in that land, and he found that same year a hundredfold: and the Lord blessed him.
column4: Sevit autem Isaac in terra illa et invenit in ipso anno centuplum; benedixitque ei Dominus.

column2: And the man was enriched, and he went on prospering and increasing, till he became exceeding great.
column4: Et locupletatus est homo et ibat proficiens atque succrescens, donec magnus vehementer effectus est.

column2: And he had possessions of sheep and of herds, and a very great family.
column4: Habuitque possessionem ovium et armentorum et familiæ plurimum.

column2: Wherefore the Palestines envying him, stopped up at that time all the wells, that the servants of his father, Abraham, had digged, filling them up with Earth.
column4: Ob hæc invidentes ei Philisthim omnes puteos, quos foderant servi patris illius in diebus Abraham, obstruxerunt implentes humo.

column2: Insomuch that Abimelech himself said to Isaac: Depart from us, for thou art become much mightier than we.
column4: In tantum ut ipse Abimelech diceret ad Isaac: Recede a nobis, quoniam potentior nostri factus es valde.

column2: So he departed, and came to the torrent of Gerara, to dwell there.
column4: Et ille discedens tentoria fixit ad torrentem Geraræ habitavitque ibi.

column2: And he digged again other wells, which the servants of his father, Abraham, had digged, and which, after his death, the Philistines had of old stopped up: and he called them by the same names, by which his father before had called them.
column4: Rursum fodit puteos, quos foderant in diebus patris sui Abraham et quos, illo mortuo, obstruxerant Philisthim. Appellavitque eos eisdem nominibus, quibus ante pater vocaverat.

column2: And they digged in the torrent, and found living water.
column4: Foderunt servi Isaac in torrente et reppererunt ibi puteum aquæ vivæ.

column2: But there also the herdsmen of Gerara strove against the herdsmen of Isaac, saying: It is our water. Wherefore he called the name of the well, on occasion of that which had happened, Calumny.
column4: Sed et ibi iurgium fuit pastorum Geraræ adversus pastores Isaac dicentium: “Nostra est aqua!” Quam ob rem nomen putei vocavit Esec (id est Iurgium), quia iurgati sunt cum eo.

column2: And they digged also another; and for that they quarrelled likewise, and he called the name of it, Enmity.
column4: Foderunt autem et alium puteum, et pro illo quoque rixati sunt; appellavitque eum Sitna (id est Inimicitias).

column2: Going forward from thence, he digged another well, for which they contended not; therefore he called the name thereof, Latitude, saying: Now hath the Lord given us room, and made us to increase upon the earth.
column4: Profectus inde fodit alium puteum, pro quo non contenderunt; itaque vocavit nomen eius Rehoboth (id est Latitudinem) dicens: Nunc dilatavit nos Dominus, et crescemus in terra.

column2: And he went up from that place to Bersabee, where the Lord appeared to him that same night, saying: I am the God of Abraham thy father, do not fear, for I am with thee: I will bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my servant Abraham's sake.
column4: Ascendit autem ex illo loco in Bersabee, ubi apparuit ei Dominus in ipsa nocte dicens: Ego sum Deus Abraham patris tui. Noli timere, quia tecum sum; benedicam tibi et multiplicabo semen tuum propter servum meum Abraham.

column2: And he built there an altar: and called upon the name of the Lord, and pitched his tent; and commanded his servants to dig a well.
column4: Itaque ædificavit ibi altare et, invocato nomine Domini, extendit tabernaculum, et servi Isaac foderunt ibi puteum.

column2: To which place when Abimelech, and Ochozath his friend, and Phicol chief captain of his soldiers, came from Gerara, Isaac said to them: Why are ye come to me, a man whom you hate, and have thrust out from you?
column4: Abimelech autem venit ad eum de Geraris et Ochozath amicus illius et Phicol dux militum, et locutus est eis Isaac: Quid venistis ad me hominem, quem odistis et expulistis a vobis?

column2: And they answered: We saw that the Lord is with thee, and therefore we said: Let there be an oath between us, and let us make a covenant, that thou do us no harm, as we on our part have touched nothing of thine, nor have done any thing to hurt thee; but with peace have sent thee away, increased with the blessing of the Lord.
column4: Qui responderunt: Vidimus tecum esse Dominum et idcirco diximus: Sit iuramentum inter nos et te, et ineamus tecum fœdus, ut non facias nobis quidquam mali, sicut et nos non attigimus te et nihil fecimus tibi nisi bonum et cum pace dimisimus te. Tu es enim benedictus Domini.

column2: And he made them a feast, and after they had eaten and drunk.
column4: Fecit ergo eis convivium, et comederunt et biberunt.

column2: Arising in the morning, they swore one to another: and Isaac sent them away peaceably to their own home.
column4: Surgentesque mane iuraverunt sibi mutuo. Dimisitque eos Isaac, et profecti sunt ab eo cum pace.

column2: And behold, the same day the servants of Isaac came, telling him of a well which they had digged, and saying: We have found water.
column4: Ecce autem venerunt in ipso die servi Isaac annuntiantes ei de puteo, quem foderant, atque dicentes: Invenimus aquam.

column2: Whereupon he called it Abundance: and the name of the city was called Bersabee, even to this day.
column4: Unde appellavit eum Sabee (quod significat Abundantiam); et nomen urbi impositum est Bersabee usque in præsentem diem.

column2: And Esau being forty years old, married wives, Judith, the daughter of Beeri, the Hethite, and Basemath, the daughter of Elon, of the same place.
column4: Esau vero quadragenarius duxit uxores Iudith filiam Beeri Hetthæi et Basemath filiam Elon Hetthæi.

column2: And they both offended the mind of Isaac and Rebecca.
column4: Quæ ambæ offenderant animum Isaac et Rebeccæ.

column2: Now Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, and he could not see: and he called Esau, his elder son, and said to him: My son? And he answered: Here I am.
column4: Senuit autem Isaac, et caligaverunt oculi eius, et videre non poterat. Vocavitque Esau filium suum maiorem et dixit ei: “Fili mi”. Qui respondit: “Adsum”.

column2: And his father said to him, Thou seest that I am old, and know not the day of my death. Take thy arms, thy quiver, and bow, and go abroad; and when thou hast taken something by hunting, make me a savoury meat thereof, as thou knowest I like, and bring it that I may eat: and my soul may bless thee, before I die.
column4: Cui pater: Vides, inquit, quod senuerim et ignorem diem mortis meæ; sume arma tua, pharetram et arcum, et egredere in agrum. Cumque venatu aliquid apprehenderis, fac mihi inde pulmentum, sicut velle me nosti, et affer, ut comedam; et benedicat tibi anima mea, antequam moriar.

column2: And when Rebecca had heard this, and he was gone into the field to fulfil his father's commandment,
column4: Rebecca autem audierat Isaac loquentem cum Esau filio suo. Esau ergo abiit in agrum, ut venationem caperet et offerret eam.

column2: She said to her son Jacob: I heard thy father talking with Esau, thy brother, and saying to him: Bring me of thy hunting, and make me meats that I may eat, and bless thee in the sight of the Lord, before I die.
column4: Rebecca autem dixit filio suo Iacob: Ecce, audivi patrem tuum loquentem cum Esau fratre tuo et dicentem ei: "Affer mihi venationem tuam et fac cibos, ut comedam et benedicam tibi coram Domino, antequam moriar".

column2: Now therefore, my son, follow my counsel: And go thy way to the flock, bring me two kids of the best, that I may make of them meat for thy father, such as he gladly eateth. Which when thou hast brought in, and he hath eaten, he may bless thee before he die.
column4: Nunc ergo, fili mi, audi vocem meam in eo, quod præcipio tibi. Pergens ad gregem affer mihi duos hædos optimos, ut faciam ex eis escas patri tuo, quibus libenter vescitur. Quas cum intuleris patri tuo, et comederit, benedicat tibi, priusquam moriatur.

column2: And he answered her: Thou knowest that Esau, my brother, is a hairy man, and I am smooth: if my father should feel me, and perceive it, I fear lest he will think I would have mocked him, and I shall bring upon me a curse instead of a blessing.
column4: Cui ille respondit: Nosti quod Esau frater meus homo pilosus sit, et ego lenis. Si attrectaverit me pater meus et senserit, timeo, ne putet me sibi voluisse illudere; et inducam super me maledictionem pro benedictione.

column2: And his mother said to him: Upon me be this curse, my son: only hear thou my voice, and go, fetch me the things which I have said.
column4: Ad quem mater: In me sit, ait, ista maledictio, fili mi; tantum audi vocem meam et perge afferque, quæ dixi.

column2: He went, and brought, and gave them to his mother. She dressed meats, such as she knew his father liked.
column4: Abiit et attulit deditque matri. Paravit illa cibos, sicut noverat velle patrem illius.

column2: And she put on him very good garments of Esau, which she had at home with her: and the little skins of the kids she put about his hands, and covered the bare of his neck.
column4: Et vestibus Esau valde bonis, quas apud se habebat domi, induit eum pelliculasque hædorum circumdedit manibus et colli nuda protexit.

column2: And she gave him the savoury meat, and delivered him bread that she had baked.
column4: Dedit pulmentum optimum et panes, quos coxerat, in manus filii sui Iacob.

column2: Which when he had carried in, he said: My father? But he answered: I hear. Who art thou, my son?
column4: Qui ingressus ad patrem suum dixit: “Pater mi”. At ille respondit: “Audio. Quis es tu, fili mi?”

column2: And Jacob said: I am Esau, thy firstborn: I have done as thou didst command me: arise, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.
column4: Dixitque Iacob ad patrem suum: Ego sum Esau primogenitus tuus. Feci sicut præcepisti mihi; surge, sede et comede de venatione mea, ut benedicat mihi anima tua.

column2: And Isaac said to his son: How couldst thou find it so quickly, my son? He answered: It was the will of God, that what I sought came quickly in my way.
column4: Rursum Isaac ad filium suum: "Quomodo, inquit, tam cito invenire potuisti, fili mi?" Qui respondit: “Voluntas Domini Dei tui fuit, ut occurreret mihi”.

column2: And Isaac said: Come hither, that I may feel thee, my son, and may prove whether thou be my son Esau, or no.
column4: Dixitque Isaac ad Iacob: Accede huc, ut tangam te, fili mi, et probem, utrum tu sis filius meus Esau an non.

column2: He came near to his father, and when he had felt him, Isaac said: The voice indeed is the voice of Jacob; but the hands, are the hands of Esau.
column4: Accessit ille ad patrem, et, palpato eo, dixit Isaac: Vox quidem, vox Iacob est, sed manus, manus sunt Esau.

column2: He said: Art thou my son Esau? He answered: I am.
column4: Ait: “Tu es filius meus Esau?” Respondit: “Ego sum”.

column2: Then he said: Bring me the meats of thy hunting, my son, that my soul may bless thee. And when they were brought, and he had eaten, he offered him wine also, which after he had drunk, he said to him: Come near me, and give me a kiss, my son.
column4: At ille: “Affer, inquit, mihi, et comedam de venatione tua, fili mi, ut benedicat tibi anima mea”. Quos cum oblatos comedisset, obtulit ei etiam vinum. Quo hausto, dixit ad eum Isaac pater eius: “Accede ad me et da mihi osculum, fili mi”.

column2: He came near, and kissed him. And immediately as he smelled the fragrant smell of his garments, blessing him, he said: Behold, the smell of my son is as the smell of a plentiful field, which the Lord hath blessed.
column4: Accessit et osculatus est eum. Statimque, ut sensit vestimentorum illius fragrantiam, benedicens illi ait: Ecce odor filii mei sicut odor agri pleni, cui benedixit Dominus.

column2: God give thee of the dew of heaven, and of the fatness of the earth, abundance of corn and wine.
column4: Det tibi Deus de rore cæli et de pinguedine terræ et abundantiam frumenti et vini.

column2: And let peoples serve thee, and tribes worship thee: be thou lord of thy brethren, and let thy mother's children bow down before thee. Cursed be he that curseth thee: and let him that blesseth thee be filled with blessings.
column4: Et serviant tibi populi, et adorent te nationes; esto dominus fratrum tuorum, et incurventur ante te filii matris tuæ. Qui maledixerit tibi, sit maledictus; et, qui benedixerit tibi, sit benedictus!

column2: Isaac had scarce ended his words, when, Jacob being now gone out abroad, Esau came, and brought in to his father meats, made of what he had taken in hunting, saying: Arise, my father, and eat of thy son's venison; that thy soul may bless me.
column4: Vix Isaac benedictionem Iacob finierat, et Iacob egressus erat a patre suo Isaac, venit Esau frater eius coctosque de venatione cibos intulit patri dicens: Surge, pater mi, et comede de venatione filii tui, ut benedicat mihi anima tua.

column2: And Isaac said to him: Why! who art thou? He answered: I am thy firstborn son, Esau.
column4: Dixitque illi Isaac pater eius: “Quis enim es tu?” Qui respondit: “Ego sum filius tuus primogenitus Esau”.

column2: Isaac was struck with fear, and astonished exceedingly; and wondering beyond what can be believed, said: Who is he then that even now brought me venison that he had taken, and I ate of all before thou camest? and I have blessed him, and he shall be blessed.
column4: Expavit Isaac stupore vehementi ultra modum et ait: Quis igitur ille est, qui dudum captam venationem attulit mihi, et comedi ex omnibus, priusquam tu venires? Benedixique ei, et erit benedictus!

column2: Esau having heard his father's words, roared out with a great cry; and, being in a consternation, said: Bless me also, my father.
column4: Auditis Esau sermonibus patris, irrugiit clamore magno et amaro ultra modum et ait patri suo: Benedic etiam mihi, pater mi!

column2: And he said: Thy brother came deceitfully and got thy blessing.
column4: Qui ait: Venit germanus tuus fraudulenter et accepit benedictionem tuam.

column2: But he said again: Rightly is his name called Jacob; for he hath supplanted me lo this second time: My birthright he took away before, and now this second time he hath stolen away my blessing. And again he said to his father: Hast thou not reserved me also a blessing?
column4: At ille subiunxit: “Iuste vocatum est nomen eius Iacob; supplantavit enim me en altera vice: primogenita mea ante tulit et nunc secundo surripuit benedictionem meam”. Rursumque ait: “Numquid non reservasti mihi benedictionem?”

column2: Isaac answered: I have appointed him thy lord, and have made all his brethren his servants: I have established him with corn and wine, and after this, what shall I do more for thee, my son?
column4: Respondit Isaac: Ecce, dominum tuum illum constitui et omnes fratres eius servituti illius subiugavi; frumento et vino stabilivi eum. Et tibi post hæc, fili mi, ultra quid faciam?

column2: And Esau said to him: Hast thou only one blessing, father? I beseech thee bless me also.
column4: Dixitque Esau ad patrem suum: Num unam tantum benedictionem habes, pater mi? Mihi quoque obsecro, ut benedicas!

column2: And when he wept with a loud cry, Isaac being moved, said to him: In the fat of the earth, and in the dew of heaven from above, shall thy blessing be.
column4: Cumque eiulatu magno fleret, motus Isaac dixit ad eum: Ecce, procul a pinguedine terræ erit habitatio tua et procul a rore cæli desuper.

column2: Thou shalt live by the sword, and shalt serve thy brother: and the time shall come, when thou shalt shake off and loose his yoke from thy neck.
column4: De gladio tuo vives et fratri tuo servies. Tempusque veniet, cum excutias et solvas iugum eius de cervicibus tuis.

column2: Esau therefore always hated Jacob, for the blessing wherewith his father had blessed him; and he said in his heart: The days will come of the mourning for my father, and I will kill my brother Jacob.
column4: Oderat ergo Esau Iacob pro benedictione, qua benedixerat ei pater, dixitque in corde suo: Appropinquabunt dies luctus patris mei, et occidam Iacob fratrem meum.

column2: These things were told to Rebecca: and she sent and called Jacob, her son, and said to him: Behold Esau, thy brother, threateneth to kill thee.
column4: Nuntiata sunt Rebeccæ verba Esau filii eius maioris, quæ mittens et vocans Iacob filium suum minorem dixit ad eum: Ecce, Esau frater tuus minatur, ut occidat te.

column2: Now therefore, my son, hear my voice, arise and flee to Laban, my brother, to Haran: And thou shalt dwell with him a few days, till the wrath of thy brother be assuaged, and his indignation cease, and he forget the things thou hast done to him.
column4: Nunc ergo, fili mi, audi vocem meam et consurgens fuge ad Laban fratrem meum in Charran; habitabisque cum eo dies paucos, donec requiescat furor fratris tui, et cesset indignatio eius, obliviscaturque eorum, quæ fecisti in eum.

column2: Afterwards I will send, and bring thee from thence hither. Why shall I be deprived of both my sons in one day?
column4: Postea mittam et adducam te inde huc. Cur utroque orbabor filio in uno die?

column2: And Rebecca said to Isaac: I am weary of my life, because of the daughters of Heth: if Jacob take a wife of the stock of this land, I choose not to live.
column4: Dixit quoque Rebecca ad Isaac: Tædet me vitæ meæ propter filias Heth; si acceperit Iacob uxorem de filiabus Heth sicut istis de filiabus terræ, nolo vivere.

column2: And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, saying: Take not a wife of the stock of Canaan, but go, and take a journey to Mesopotamia of Syria, to the house of Bathuel, thy mother's father, and take thee a wife thence of the daughters of Laban, thy uncle.
column4: Vocavit itaque Isaac Iacob et benedixit eum præcepitque ei dicens: Noli accipere coniugem de filiabus Chanaan; surge, vade in Paddanaram ad domum Bathuel patris matris tuæ et accipe tibi inde uxorem de filiabus Laban avunculi tui.

column2: And God almighty bless thee, and make thee to increase and multiply thee: that thou mayst be a multitude of people.
column4: Deus autem omnipotens benedicat tibi et crescere te faciat atque multiplicet, ut sis in multitudinem populorum.

column2: And give the blessings of Araham to thee, and to thy seed after thee: that thou mayst possess the land of thy sojournment, which he promised to thy grandfather.
column4: Et det tibi benedictiones Abraham tibi et semini tuo tecum, ut possideas terram peregrinationis tuæ, quam pollicitus est Deus avo tuo.

column2: And when Isaac had sent him away, he took his journey and went to Mesopotamia of Syria, to Laban, the son of Bathuel, the Syrian, brother to Rebecca, his mother.
